ratings.question_text: What is your overall assessment of this course?

narratives.question_text: How would you summarize AFAM 505 01/AMST 643 01 for a fellow student? Would you recommend AFAM 505 01/AMST 643 01 to another student? Why or why not?
comments: My initial description of the class would be that it is a lot of work but is also super rewarding. Problem sets/exams often did not always reinforce the material from lecture. Many times problem sets/exams seemed more like a test of proofing/mathematical derivations rather than applying course material. The exams were always I took the class thinking the workload would be substantial, but I did not expect to spend such a significant amount of time on the problem sets--too many and too long. All of this into consideration, I would definitely take this course again, no questions. This course was off-field for me, but I have never been more challenged or gained so much knowledge from a class. My advice to another student would be take it but to take multivariate calc, diff eq/ODE/PDE, and fluid dynamics first (recently). I think I would have gotten more out of it with these classes under my belt, rather than spending significant time reteaching myself the math.

narratives.question_text: How did this course deepen your knowledge of your discipline/profession? To what extent did this course contribute to your dissertation/research?
comments: I wanted to take this class to really understand how fluid dynamics contribute to movement in aquatic systems. I got that--and SO much more. I am so glad I took this class and stuck with it. It was difficult and challenging but very rewarding. I am much more confident in not just PO but also in my math/physics skills, in general.
